text: We recently created a subdomain for our account, and I'm not sure how to edit pages/files on that subdomain? Any help would be much appreciated :thumbsup::skin-tone-4: Thanks!

I happened to notice yesterday that the APPLY CHANGES button has disappear in the CMS when editing a custom module.  Does anyone else see the button there or see that it's gone?

When adding text to a rich text editor inside of a custom module there is no way to apply those changes to the page and they are not automatically getting added.

Is this a BUG??

My bad :grimacing: . I think we jumped the gun with this on. Working on rolling it back. We’re trying to get rid of the button in cases where it shouldn’t be needed (As we “live update” the modules in ~75% of the cases, but we missed some technical cases where  our “do we need to refresh the logic” didn’t account for). Also it can be scary to not a see a confirmation that your change is actually being reflected in the page. We’ll try to think about a better way to roll this out.
Just finished rolling this back, you should be all set.

Thanks for chiming in <@UA886MF42>.  I've seen a few of instances of the new "live update" roll out which I love.  I was just a bit confused when it wasn't living updating and the button was gone as well.

```<div class="sc-banner home-banner" data-img="{{module.background_image.src}}" style="background-image: url('{{module.background_image.src}}');"> ```
Any ideas why the data-img attribute returns an actual URL and the same hubl inside the inlined css returns `background-image:url('undefined');` ?

Hi all! Just a quick question idk where to really post this but basically im trying to update my HubSpot domain security settings to only TLS 1.2+ and for some reason after i did it it still supports versions before 1.2
Having an issue with password protected page (single password) not working - says password is incorrect even though it is verbatim, seems to have happened in the last 24-36 hours.

In case someone else didn’t respond, we made a change that inadvertently requires password-protected pages to served over https. While we do want to make password-protected pages more secure, we didn’t intend to do this suddenly and without a notice period. We will roll this back ASAP.
Note that membership-based pages were always required to use HTTPS, but legacy password-protected pages did not.
